argument.definition

Class ArgumentDefinition

  • java.lang.Object
    • argument.definition.ArgumentDefinition
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    DoubleArgumentDefinition, FlagArgumentDefinition, HelpArgumentDefinition, IntegerArgumentDefinition, StringArgumentDefinition

    public class ArgumentDefinition
extends java.lang.Object
    Parent class for an argument definition. Do not use this class for an argument definition!
    Version:
    0.1
    Author:
    Steven Cybinski

    • Constructor Detail

      • ArgumentDefinition

        public ArgumentDefinition(java.lang.String[] prefixes,
                          java.lang.String description,
                          java.lang.Boolean required)
        Constructor of the Class.
        Parameters:
        prefixes - Set prefixes that can be used to get help. E.g. "-help, -h".
        description - Add a description to this argument like "IP of the target server.".
        required - Determine whether this argument is required.

    • Method Detail

        public boolean samePrefixes(ArgumentDefinition argumentDefinition)
        Check if this argument definition have the same prefix as the given one.
        Parameters:
        argumentDefinition - Specify the argument definition you want to check.
        Returns:
        Return if the prefixes are the same.

        Returns:
        Result of the search.
